sen.e: In Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code)/Yoro Ritsuryo it is one of hachigyaku defined by Meirei Ritsu (Meirei Code).

sen.j: 子（あるいは孫）が父母（あるいは祖父母）に対して行うことが違法となる行為を指し、訴訟を起こすこと、呪詛すること、罵詈を浴びせること、父母（祖父母）の許可なく勝手に戸籍や財産を分けて独立すること、父母（祖父母）の喪中（1年間）に婚姻すること、音楽などの娯楽にふけったり喪服を脱ぐこと、父母（祖父母）の死を聞いても悲しまずに平然としていること、父母（祖父母）が死んだと偽ってその妾と通じることが挙げられた。
sen.e: It refers to illegal acts done by children (or grandchildren) to their parents (or grandparents) including as follows; making suits, cursing, abusing, becoming independent by removing names from the koseki (family registers) or inheriting properties without permission, getting married during the time of mourning for parent(s) (grandparent(s) (for one year), indulging in entertainments such as music, taking off the mofuku (livery of grief), staying calm without feeling sad to hear the death of their parent(s) (grandparent(s)) and having affairs with concubines of parent(s)' (grandparent(s)') by telling a lie that they were dead.

It refers to illegal acts done by children (or grandchildren) to their parents (or grandparents) such as follows; filing a suit, cursing, abusing, becoming independent by removing names from the koseki (family register) or inheriting properties without permission, getting married during the time of mourning for parent(s) or grandparent(s) (for one year), indulging in entertainment such as music, taking off mofuku (the livery of grief), staying calm without feeling sad to hear the death of their parent(s) or grandparent(s) and having affairs with concubine of parent(s)' (grandparent(s)') by telling a lie that they were dead.
sen.cmt: 最初のgrandchildren の後の空白を削除しました。 Including → such, making suits → filing a suit, family registers → family register, entertainments → entertainment, the mofuku → mofuku, concubines → a concubine に変更しました。
sen.e: It refers to illegal acts done by children (or grandchildren) to their parents (or grandparents) such as follows; filing a suit, cursing, abusing, becoming independent by removing names from the koseki (family register) or inheriting properties without permission, getting married during the time of mourning for parent(s) or grandparent(s) (for one year), indulging in entertainment such as music, taking off mofuku (the livery of grief), staying calm without feeling sad to hear the death of their parent(s) or grandparent(s) and having affairs with concubine of parent(s)' (grandparent(s)') by telling a lie that they were dead.

sen.j: これらの行為は徒罪の対象であり、特に父母（祖父母）への訴訟は死罪_(律令法)の1つである絞に処せられて、皇族や公卿でも減刑されることが無い重罪とされた。
sen.e: These behaviors were imposed imprisonment, especially suiting parent(s) (grandparent(s)) meant death by hanging, one of Capital crimes (in Ritsuryo law), and regarded as a serious crime where no members of the Imperial Family or Kugyo (court nobles) could obtain reduced sentences.

Punishment for these behaviors was imprisonment, and especially filing a lawsuit against parent(s) (or grandparent(s)) meant death by hanging, which was one of death penalties (in Ritsuryo law), and was regarded as a serious crime that even a member of the Imperial Family or Kugyo (court nobles) could not obtain reduced sentences.
sen.cmt: "These behaviors were imposed imprisonment"ではおかしいので、Punishment を文頭に置き、訂正しました。Suiting → filing a lawsuit against, one of → which was one of, regarded → was regarded, where no members → that even a member に訂正しました。 Capital crime よりもこの場合はdeath penalty の方が正確だと考え、変更しました。
sen.e: Punishment for these behaviors was imprisonment, and especially filing a lawsuit against parent(s) (or grandparent(s)) meant death by hanging, which was one of death penalties (in Ritsuryo law), and was regarded as a serious crime that even a member of the Imperial Family or Kugyo (court nobles) could not obtain reduced sentences.

sen.j: なお、中国の律令法では、父母（祖父母）に対する供養の欠如も不孝とされていたが、日本の律令法には導入されなかった。
sen.e: As for Chinese Ritsuryo law, neglect of kuyo (memorial services for the dead) was regarded as fukyo, but it was not introduced in Japanese Ritsuryo law.
As for Chinese Ritsuryo law, neglect of kuyo (a memorial service for the dead) was regarded as fukyo, but it was not introduced in Japanese Ritsuryo law.
sen.cmt: memorial services → a memorial service に訂正しました。
sen.e: As for Chinese Ritsuryo law, neglect of kuyo (a memorial service for the dead) was regarded as fukyo, but it was not introduced in Japanese Ritsuryo law.

sen.j: 中世においては、律令法とも現代のものとも違い、父母（祖父母）側より子（孫）に対して関係を絶つ行為を指す。
sen.e: In the Middle Ages, unlike Ritsuryo law and modern law, it referred to the disownment of children (grandchildren) by their parent(s) (grandparent(s)).
In the Middle Ages, unlike Ritsuryo law and the modern law, it referred to the disownment of children (grandchildren) by their parent(s) (or grandparent(s)).
sen.cmt: modern law → the modern law に変更しました。
sen.e: In the Middle Ages, unlike Ritsuryo law and the modern law, it referred to the disownment of children (grandchildren) by their parent(s) (or grandparent(s)).

sen.j: 公家法と武家法では条件が一部異なるが、教令違反・孝養の欠如あるいは不始末・向背（命令・指示違反）・不行跡・敵対行為などの非行行為の存在が挙げられ、具体的な証拠がなくても父母（祖父母）側の主張によって認められた。
sen.e: Though there were some differences between the Kugeho (court noble law) and the Bukeho (samurai law), it included delinquencies such as violation of law/neglect of filial duties or carelessness/disobedience (violation of orders and instructions)/misconducts/hostile actions and so on, which were approved without any evidence if parent(s) ((grandparent(s)) had claimed.

Although there were some differences between the Kugeho (court noble law) and the Bukeho (samurai law), it included delinquencies such as violation of law, neglect of filial duties or carelessness, disobedience (violation of orders and instructions), misconducts or hostile actions and so on, which were approved without any evidence if parent(s) (or grandparent(s)) had claimed.
sen.cmt: Though → Although に変更しました。文中のスラッシュを取ってコンマに置き換えました。
sen.e: Although there were some differences between the Kugeho (court noble law) and the Bukeho (samurai law), it included delinquencies such as violation of law, neglect of filial duties or carelessness, disobedience (violation of orders and instructions), misconducts or hostile actions and so on, which were approved without any evidence if parent(s) (or grandparent(s)) had claimed.

sen.j: 不孝と認定された子は家から放逐され、嫡子としての家督継承権や財産の相続権なども全て剥奪され、既に分与・継承された財産は没収されて父母（祖父母）のもとに戻された（悔返）。
sen.e: Children certified as "fukyo" were driven away from home, deprived everything including the rights to inherit the family and properties, and so on as legitimate children, and the property they had already given were returned to their parents (grandparents) (kuikaeshi).

A child certified as "fukyo" was driven away from home, deprived of everything including the rights to inherit the family and properties, and so on for which he was eligible as a legitimate child, and the property already given to them was returned to their parents or grandparents (kuikaeshi).
sen.cmt: deprived → deprived of, children → child に訂正しました。わかりやすくするため、for which he was eligible を as a legitimate child の前に入れました。最後のproperty 以降の文を訂正しました。
sen.e: A child certified as "fukyo" was driven away from home, deprived of everything including the rights to inherit the family and properties, and so on for which he was eligible as a legitimate child, and the property already given to them was returned to their parents or grandparents (kuikaeshi).

sen.j: なお、義絶もほぼ同一であるが、父母（祖父母）側は内外にその事実を公表して証拠となる義絶状を作成すること、子（孫）が犯罪を犯しても連座の対象にならないことに違いがあった。
sen.e: 義絶 (gizetsu or disownment) was almost the same except that parent(s) (grandparent(s)) should make fact public inside and outside the family and make an epistle of cancellation of breaking off the relations and that they were excluded from complicity in a crime even if their children (grandchildren) committed a crime.

義絶 (gizetsu or disownment) was almost the same except that parent(s) or grandparent(s) should disclose the fact inside and outside the family and make an epistle of disownment as a proof and that they were excluded from complicity in a crime even if their child (or a grandchild) committed a crime.
sen.cmt: 二重カッコを避けるため、grandparent(s) の前にorを入れました。make fact public → disclose the fact に変更しました。意味がおかしいため cancellation of breaking off the relations → disownment に変更しました。「証拠となる」の部分が訳漏れでしたので、as a proof を追加しました。children を単数に訂正しました。
sen.e: 義絶 (gizetsu or disownment) was almost the same except that parent(s) or grandparent(s) should disclose the fact inside and outside the family and make an epistle of disownment as a proof and that they were excluded from complicity in a crime even if their child (or a grandchild) committed a crime.

sen.j: もっとも、南北朝時代_(日本)には単なる不孝でも死後の紛糾を避けるために証拠文書などの作成が必要となり、不孝は義絶の別称となった。
sen.e: However, in the Nanboku Cho period (Northern and Southern Dynasties) (Japan) in order to avoid complications after death it became necessary to make an evidential document, which made fukyo another term for gizetsu.

However, in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts, it became necessary to make an evidential document in order to avoid complications after death, and the term fukyo has come to mean the same thing as gizetsu.
sen.cmt: 誤訳： the Nanboku Cho period (Northern and Southern Dynasties) (Japan) → the period of the Northern and Southern Courts に変更しました。Courts の後にコンマを入れました。in order to 以降の節とit bacame necessary 以降の節の語順を入れ替えました。Which made fukyo 以降の部分の訳が不正確なので、訂正しました。
sen.e: However, in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts, it became necessary to make an evidential document in order to avoid complications after death, and the term fukyo has come to mean the same thing as gizetsu.

sen.j: 更に室町時代に入ると、本来は主従間の関係断絶行為であった勘当という行為が家族内にも適用されて不孝・義絶と同じ法的効果をもたらすようになり、不孝という言葉は使われなくなった。
sen.e: From the early Muromachi period the act of kando (disownment), which originally meant extinction of the relation between master and servant, came to be applied to a familial relation and have the same legal effect as fukyo/gizetsu, resulting in that the term fukyo was no longer used.

Moreover, from the early Muromachi period the act of kando (disownment), which originally meant extinction of the relation between master and servant, came to be applied to a familial relation and have the same legal effect as fukyo/gizetsu, resulting in that the term fukyo was no longer used.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ：更に→ Moreover を文頭に追加しました。
sen.e: Moreover, from the early Muromachi period the act of kando (disownment), which originally meant extinction of the relation between master and servant, came to be applied to a familial relation and have the same legal effect as fukyo/gizetsu, resulting in that the term fukyo was no longer used.

sen.j: そのため、江戸時代以後は父母（祖父母）が子（孫）との関係を絶つことを「勘当」、それ以外の親族による縁戚関係断絶行為一般を「義絶」と称するようになった。
sen.e: Therefore, in and after the Edo period the term "kando" came to be used to mean the extinction of the relation between parents (grandparents) and children (grandchildren), while the term "gizetsu" came to be used to mean other general acts of canceling the kinship by relatives.
